file_content.text: Thank you. We've moved everyone out of the bombing area.
I've got your datapad, despite the Empire's best efforts.
Excellent work! Hang on, and I'll alert Captain Arden.
Brilliant. That datapad holds the Empire's bombing trajectories. Knowing those will save a lot of lives.
I'm ready to help with whatever you need. Just say the word.
What else can I do?
We need to review this data in detail first. If we need something else, we'll find you.
Don't forget who saved you.
Don't worry, we'll make certain to give credit where it's due.
Agreed! The Republic thanks you.
Recovering this data wasn't cheap, and didn't come easy.
How about some credits?
I don't care about your expenses--I care about saving lives.
If that's not good enough for you, perhaps you should find another line of work. Good day.
The Republic appreciates your sacrifice. I wish we could do more.
There's no time to waste! You have to find that escape pod!
A Jedi! I'm glad to see you. We need all the help we can get.
Captain, thank the Force. You're here right when I need you.
I hope you weren't planning on going anywhere, spacer. I have to put a huge dent in your plans.
Excellent, another volunteer! We need every able body available.
Republic fighters just shot down an Imperial transport near enemy territory, but it looks like it launched an escape pod.
Whoever's on board must be important--the Empire's sending troops over the border like we're giving away Mandalorian ale.
That seems like a lot of fuss over an escape pod.
What does the Empire want?
Agreed. But we can't let the Empire get a foothold so--hold on.
What do you need?
We're setting up a defensive perimeter against--hold on.
I'm sure you've got ground troops to handle this.
That's not really my job.
The Empire's throwing every man they've got across the border. We need more than--hold on.
Excellent work, Captain Elson. I see you've already assembled a team.
Good work, Captain Elson. I see you've already found someone.
Captain Arden! What can we do for the SIS?
At the moment, you can listen. Get someone to that escape pod, now. We must reach it before the Empire does.
I had two agents on that ship who hid vital Republic information aboard the pod.
When the SIS calls, we answer. Looks like the plan has changed slightly... can you recover the data from that pod before the Empire finds it?
The Empire has enough Republic secrets. They won't get anymore.
Sign me up.
I will trust in the Force and make my way there now.
I can only do my best.
I'll be in and out before the Empire knows I'm there.
This is what I'm best at.
It'll be like you never lost it.
I'll bring your data back.
When I take a job, I like to know who I'm working for.
Who are you?
The less you know, the better. Knowledge is power, and I'm not in the business of sharing.
All you need to know is two men paid in blood for that information. We have to get it back.
You've got to be crazy.
Without that intelligence data, we'll all be dead.
The Republic needs your help. Can we count on you to recover that data?
I'm risking my neck--what's your part in this?
Any backup available?
We'll engage the Empire where we can, but you've got to go in alone or we'd risk too much attention.
I love bad odds.
The Empire's sending their best snow troops, so expect heavy resistance.
The pod went down near these coordinates. You'll need to move fast.
Bring the datapad to me when you find it. I'll get it to Captain Arden. Good luck!
No thanks. [Refuse quest]
I hope you're as nonchalant when the Empire's bombs are raining down on us.
Find someone else, Elson. Quickly!
Sir! Yes, sir!
The Empire's moving troops around again. Let me know if you see anything.
